snippet: Qing Quentin Huang was allegedly trying to sell secrets about Canada’s new naval shipbuilding program to China, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police said.
abstract: Royal Canadian Mounted Police say they have arrested Ontario resident Qing Quentin Huang on charges of trying to sell secrets about Canada's naval shipbuilding program to China; Huang was employed by Lloyd's Register, a subcontractor to a company building Canadian warships.
lead_paragraph: Qing Quentin Huang was allegedly trying to sell secrets about Canada’s new naval shipbuilding program to China, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police said.

headline.main: Ontario Man Accused of Plot to Sell Secrets
headline.print_headline: Ontario Man Accused of Plot to Sell Secrets
